comment: Anyone that rates this professor below 5 stars because they couldn't ai their way through a philosophy course is kidding themselves. Her courses require you to read and attend class. If you can do that you will get an A. If you have come to college to learn, take her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Liked her as a person, but found the class difficult for a gen ed. You HAVE to go to the lectures to get  any clue what's going on, but honestly they were easy to listen to. Written papers were very hard and time consuming, I recommend getting them checked by a tutor. Midterm was on paper in person but honestly if you study HARD you can get a B.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Respected--Lecture heavy

comment:
Dr. Donahue obviously cares about making sure students understand the material, and allowing people to speak their minds on philosophical topics. Even if you have a controversial take, she'll openly consider it, and if she disagrees she'd do it in a respectful way. 

Does require readings and an understanding of the material, aka trying in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Tough grader when it comes to written assignments. Dont have clear rubrics for them and bad at even explaining the assignment. Lectures are boring, she does care about her students, but she doesn't have clear grading criteria.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: She's great if you're open to questioning what you think and working to improve your academic skills. If you want an easy A or B, this isn't it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: The worst professor I have had so far! Not easy to communicate with at all. Grades poorly and extreme on papers. The material is irrelevant. Quizzes are written response and only worth 10% while class participation is 20%. She has you read papers and books that are confusing and difficult to follow and understand. Worst class I have taken for sure.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Donahue is very kind! She gives thought provoking lectures, and the reading assignments are not unbearable or too heavy. She gives good feedback and wants her students to succeed. Come to class and complete the reading!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very tough grader. Ironically I feel that she is closed minded for a philosophy class. Unless you really like philosophy, I would not take her or this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is a very passionate and funny professor, every class was an adventure within itself. She grades the papers somewhat hard but she's pretty lenient with everything else. The class content itself is complex considering this is a critical thinking class, but if you do the readings and actually participate in class, it makes it a lot easier.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She is THE BEST! Literally changed my world views on so many levels! Her class is not "easy," but this is university, what do you expect? She is clear and fair and she definitely cares. I would take more classes with her if i could.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Lecture heavy

comment: BEST TEACHER EVER! Yes, the class wasn't easy, I had to work hard. But as a philosophy buff, IT WAS SO WORTH IT FOR THE LECTURES. Everyone was engaged and I made my first friends in this online class during the pandemic. She's super funny and will take her time to explain hard concepts. You got 4 papers, one optional. Best choice in my opinion!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: You read Phil works such as Socrates, Kant, Thich na hanh, Karl Marx, etc. There's weekly quizzes based off of reading. 4 papers. Miss 3 times w/out excuse your grade drops a letter. Amy is passionate about the subject and it can be quite an interesting class, but it's not an easy grade
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 3 papers and weekly quizzes. Quizzes are easy, but she grades the papers hard. Lots of feedback on papers! Lots of class discussions and amazing lectures. She's willing to help and is very responsive, relatable, and understanding. If you work for it and utilize resources and her feedback, you'll be fine. Go to class, she explains everything!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: Attendance is 20% of the grade so if you show up to class a participate Dr. Donahue can really help your grade. She is very knowledgeable of the content and good at explaining concepts. However, this is a difficult course if you are looking for an easy elective this is NOT it. That said, if you show up and read an A is not too hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: You must read all required texts, or you will do poorly on your Midterm and Final papers. You have to attend class because attendance and participation is mandatory. She's a nice person though, and she puts a lot of effort into her feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you take Logic, be prepared to do LOTS of homework. There really is no way around it. If you want to do well in Logic, you HAVE to put in the effort. Go to class, go to SI sessions, attend class. It was one of the most difficult classes I've ever taken, and I've passed Differential Equations.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: So. Much. Reading. The material that we read throughout the class was very difficult. You were expected to read every night/before every class, and if you don't, the lecture/discussions won't make any sense. Prof. Donahue is very nice, but the material is too difficult and the essays were always super long. Not an easy class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Dr. Donahue was my favorite professor this semester! Approachable and knowledgeable. She is ready to help you help yourself learn more about the world around you. She's reasonable and easy to talk to. Would recommend!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: I took a 2000 level course. It should not have been that in depth. However, the books were great with the exception of Karl Marx which took up half the semester. Shes cool though, listening to her talk and interact was always interesting to say the least and she enjoys what she does.

She loves to discuss and hear your opinions, and is happy to help and try to make the text more understandable for her students. The class is very hard, and the text is challenging, but Dr. Donahue is a great professor
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Class is made up of discussions and several papers. Quizzes help you organize ideas for the papers and receive feedback. The more you participate, the easier the class will be.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: Professor Donahue is such an interesting and knowledgeable teacher! She truly knows her stuff and really tries to help everyone understand it. This class is a lot of reading difficult material but if you read and pay attention in class you will do well! She also offers help anytime during her office hours if you need it. Ended up being by fav class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Donahue clearly knows her stuff. That is not to say that the stuff she knows is easy to understand, but she is knowledgeable and she likes to make you think critically about the readings. The readings may seem strange at first, but you can see how the topics are still relevant, and so is critically thinking about them. Loved her class.

HARDEST. CLASS. EVER. Dr. Donahue is always there to lend a helping hand. Mid semester she started doing in class examples that helped more students understand. Waste no time on the tests. They're designed to take the whole test period- they're hard! This class should be renamed to The Language of Logic: SL & PL. Not really helpful for LSAT L-games

Logic was difficult, and that's not a word I throw around too often. The class itself was decent, but the textbook and answer document errors paired with the professor's need to cater to the lowest common denominator made the final several weeks much more painful than they needed to be. Great prof, but this course could have been better.

RUN !  just run and when you think you've run enough keep running. She definitely prefers papers to tests so if you're a poor writer don't even think about this class. The grades include (2) 5-7 page papers, (2) 4 and half page papers and weekly quizzes.  Make sure to take clear notes and prepare for dense reading. I don't recommend missing class.

Professor Donahue obviously know what she's talking about and knows how to explain it very well, but due to the nature of the material it can easily get confusing and difficult. She is willing to help any of her students in and out of class. THIS IS NOT AN EASY A, but forces you to think about real-life applicable subjects. Well worth the effort.

Dr Donahue is so passionate about philosophy but hates that its a gen ed. She grades her papers SO hard and the material is so deep for a gen ed. Its a very intimidating class and I even got marked off because I was not comfortable speaking in front of the class. I honestly would not recommend this class to anyone. Run.

Amazing professor. She makes you work hard for your grade, but her lectures are always interesting. She is very helpful, and is willing to clarify anything you have questions about. This is not an easy-A class, however it was worth the tuition to take it. Don't be scared by other people's reviews. They were probably expecting an overly easy class.

Not my most favorite class. Dr. Donahue is a little intimidating but she's pretty nice. I just think she gets frustrated that we were only there for GenED and not Philosophy majors. No tests, just 4 papers. She doesn't grade quickly so don't expect to know what your grade is throughout the course or before going into the final.
Horrid. Just horrid. It is extremely difficult. She grades papers like a mad man, and this class is absolutely boring. Run .
Worst teacher ever. The most boring class I have ever taken at ksu. Should have taken another professor who understands this is a gen Ed class not philosophy major class

Dr. Donahue is very willing to help, but the class is at times hard to grasp. She does her best to clarify in class, but it is a difficult subject. You have to do all your reading, be good at writing paper, and participate in class discussions to do well.

Dr.Donahue has definitely adapted,if not lowered, her teaching and grading style to accommodate the KSU mentality. I like that she actually cares if we learn versus getting the grade.With that being said, I hope she doesn't "lower" her standard too much. It's great to work with a teacher who actually cares and thinks,possibly naively,hopeful of us.

Dr.Donahue is very nice and compassionate. I haven't taken other classes with her;however,based on the comments mentioned in class, she does tend to favor a class structured on discussion rather than lecture. But,her lectures are extremely helpful in learning the material for the, and the phil department will love this, KSU  mentality. She cares.

Dr. Donahue is an incredibly intelligent woman and very passionate about her line of work. She is definitely one of those "diamond in the rough" professors I have had the pleasure of taking throughout my undergraduate studies. With that said, her classes are not simple. They require a significant amount of input on your part.

She's adapted her teaching style to include a lot more lectures than previous classes. She previously favored student-led discussions, which were often painful given the difficulty of some topics. Her new style, though, is wonderful, and class discussions arise more organically than the previous anxiety-inducing model of everyone speaking. Amazing.

I struggled with content, as the pre reqs for this class do not prepare you. Dr. Donahue was approachable, and very helpful in understanding the material. She will discuss endlessly, in group and in private, until things are clear. She cares very much that students learn rather than just make grades. Hardest class I've taken, but worth it!

THE WORST TEACHER EVER! only take this class if every class is full. She does not know how to explain the theories in a way that helps you understand the material. If you value your GPA and your sanity, do not take this teacher.

Exceptionally helpful, supportive, and patient professor. Always willing to meet outside of class, and offers generous feedback on papers prior to due date. Strongly favors class discussion, but will switch to lecture if necessary. You're going to have to work, but you'll learn a lot if you put in the effort. Highly recommended for phil majors.

Intro to Indian Philosophy. Only pre-req is Eng 1102. I took this class with no philosophical background and it was a BIG MISTAKE. This is not an intro class. You are expected to write a thesis paper by the end. Poorly organized. Felt like a kid sitting at the adult table conversation wise and it is a conversation based class. Wish I dropped it.

Lectures are extremely unorganized, there is no structure to class. Each day you discuss your opinion on the readings. Only thing that's graded is class participation, discussion postings, and papers. I was not fond of this course, nor was it very interesting, especially at 8am
